property.name: dfs.datanode.address
property.description: The address where the datanode server will listen to. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: dfs.datanode.ipc.address
property.description: The datanode ipc server address and port. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.

property.name: dfs.datanode.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a data node should report its IP address.

property.name: dfs.datanode.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a DataNode should use to determine the host name used by the NameNode for communication and display purposes.

property.name: dfs.replication.considerLoad
property.description: Decide if chooseTarget considers the target's load or not

property.name: dfs.datanode.du.reserved
property.description: Reserved space in bytes per volume. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use.

property.name: dfs.name.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node should store the name table(fsimage). If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the name table is replicated in all of the directories, for redundancy.

property.name: dfs.name.edits.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node should store the transaction (edits) file. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the transaction file is replicated in all of the directories, for redundancy. Default value is same as dfs.name.dir

property.name: dfs.permissions
property.description: If "true", enable permission checking in HDFS. If "false", permission checking is turned off, but all other behavior is unchanged. Switching from one parameter value to the other does not change the mode, owner or group of files or directories.

property.name: dfs.permissions.supergroup
property.description: The name of the group of super-users.

property.name: dfs.data.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS data node should store its blocks. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories, then data will be stored in all named directories, typically on different devices. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: dfs.replication
property.description: Default block replication. The actual number of replications can be specified when the file is created. The default is used if replication is not specified in create time.

property.name: dfs.replication.max
property.description: Maximal block replication.

property.name: dfs.replication.min
property.description: Minimal block replication.

property.name: dfs.client.block.write.retries
property.description: The number of retries for writing blocks to the data nodes, before we signal failure to the application.

property.name: dfs.blockreport.intervalMsec
property.description: Determines block reporting interval in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.blockreport.initialDelay
property.description: Delay for first block report in seconds.

property.name: dfs.heartbeat.interval
property.description: Determines datanode heartbeat interval in seconds.

property.name: dfs.namenode.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the namenode.

property.name: dfs.safemode.threshold.pct
property.description: Specifies the percentage of blocks that should satisfy the minimal replication requirement defined by dfs.replication.min. Values less than or equal to 0 mean not to start in safe mode. Values greater than 1 will make safe mode permanent.

property.name: dfs.safemode.extension
property.description: Determines extension of safe mode in milliseconds after the threshold level is reached.

property.name: dfs.balance.bandwidthPerSec
property.description: Specifies the maximum amount of bandwidth that each datanode can utilize for the balancing purpose in term of the number of bytes per second.

property.name: dfs.hosts
property.description: Names a file that contains a list of hosts that are permitted to connect to the namenode. The full pathname of the file must be specified. If the value is empty, all hosts are permitted.

property.name: dfs.hosts.exclude
property.description: Names a file that contains a list of hosts that are not permitted to connect to the namenode. The full pathname of the file must be specified. If the value is empty, no hosts are excluded.

property.name: dfs.max.objects
property.description: The maximum number of files, directories and blocks dfs supports. A value of zero indicates no limit to the number of objects that dfs supports.

property.name: dfs.namenode.decommission.interval
property.description: Namenode periodicity in seconds to check if decommission is complete.

property.name: dfs.namenode.decommission.nodes.per.interval
property.description: The number of nodes namenode checks if decommission is complete in each dfs.namenode.decommission.interval.

property.name: dfs.replication.interval
property.description: The periodicity in seconds with which the namenode computes repliaction work for datanodes.

property.name: dfs.access.time.precision
property.description: The access time for HDFS file is precise upto this value. The default value is 1 hour. Setting a value of 0 disables access times for HDFS.

property.name: dfs.support.append
property.description: Does HDFS allow appends to files? This is currently set to false because there are bugs in the "append code" and is not supported in any prodction cluster.
